intro: Hulsea vestita subsp. inyoensis, commonly known as the Inyo hulsea, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and dry slopes. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a low-growing, mat-like growth form. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
